subject: Photography
title: Tank Man: Tiananmen Square
description: A fast breakdown of Tank Man: Tiananmen Square for builders.

hook.text: On June 5, 1989, a man stood in front of a column of tanks. A photographer on a hotel balcony captured it.

buildup.text: The image of the lone man blocking military tanks became a global symbol of individual courage.

discovery.text: The photographer, Jeff Widener, smuggled the film out in a box of tea. China tried to erase the moment.

twist.text: To this day, the identity of Tank Man remains unknown. He's the world's most famous anonymous person.

climax.text: China censors the image. Millions worldwide recognize it. Photography preserves what power tries to erase.

punchline.text: One man, one tank, one frame. Unforgettable.

quiz.question: Why is the Tank Man photograph historically significant?
options: It became a global symbol of individual courage against state power
It was the first color photo from China
It won the Nobel Peace Prize
